summary: GearSwap is a Work in Progress, so there are going to be some bugs. It is not intended for novice users, you must have some modding capability / understanding of INI files. Allowing the user to switch between two different gear sets
descriptionHtml:
[color=red][size=4]VERSION HISTORY[/size][/color]
0.1a - Work in Progress

[color=red][size=4]DESCRIPTION[/size][/color]
This allows your character to switch between to gear-sets, this mod was merely designed around Roleplaying. Allowing my character to go rogue and kill ppl I was able to press the hotkey and it would switch to my Dark Brotherhood Uniform, and if i ever got the feeling to become a Thief i could switch to my Thieves Guild Armor on the fly.. by pressing a button

[color=red][size=4]IMPORTANT INFORMATION[/size][/color]
GearSwap is a work in progress. There are going to be bugs and the mod it self is not generalized around novice users. You are going to add the FormID\'s to the [color=00ffee][[/color][b][size=2][color=#66ff22]GearSwap.ini[/color][/size][/b][color=00ffee]][/color] depending on your playstyle. The format for each section in the armor code are based on Hexidecimal.

They must start with a 0x (defining the value as a hexidecimal) below shows a example of the usage.
There are 2 Sections inside [color=00ffee][[/color][b][size=2][color=#66ff22]GearSwap.ini[/color][/size][/b][color=00ffee]][/color] that are dependant on switching your gear back and forth.
[color=00ffee][[/color][b][size=2][color=#66ff22]OutFit_One[/color][/size][/b][color=00ffee]][/color] and [color=00ffee][[/color][b][size=2][color=#66ff22]OutFit_Two[/color][/size][/b][color=00ffee]][/color] these two hold the gear configuration and keycode for both gear

Example List of Armor Codes
[url=http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Armor]http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Armor[/url]

[size=2][color=red]NOTE[/color][/size] - [b]You must have the gear in your inventory for this to work[/b]

Example Configuration
[color=00ffee][[/color][b][size=2][color=#66ff22]OutFit_One[/color][/size][/b][color=00ffee]][/color]
[list]
[*] [size=2][color=red]key=0x70[/color][/size] - [b]F1 Key.. Do not edit[/b]
[*] [size=2][color=red]Armor=0x000D2844[/color][/size] - [b]Shrouded Armor[/b]
[*] [size=2][color=red]Boots=0x000D2845[/color][/size] - [b]Shrouded Boots[/b]
[*] [size=2][color=red]Helmet=0x000D2842[/color][/size] - [b]Shrouded Cowl[/b]
[*] [size=2][color=red]Gloves=0x000D2843[/color][/size] - [b]Shrouded Gloves[/b]
[/list]

[color=00ffee][[/color][b][size=2][color=#66ff22]OutFit_Two[/color][/size][/b][color=00ffee]][/color]
[list]
[*] [size=2][color=red]key=0x70[/color][/size] - [b]F1 Key.. Do not edit[/b]
[*] [size=2][color=red]Armor=0x000d3ac3[/color][/size] - [b]Thieves Guild Armor[/b]
[*] [size=2][color=red]Boots=0x000d3ac2[/color][/size] - [b]Thieves Guild Boots[/b]
[*] [size=2][color=red]Helmet=0x000d3ac5[/color][/size] - [b]Thieves Guild Hood[/b]
[*] [size=2][color=red]Gloves=0x000d3ac4[/color][/size] - [b]Thieves Guild Gloves[/b]
[/list]

How to switch between the two? F1 and SHIFT+F1 will you to switch between the two

[color=red][size=4]INSTALL[/size][/color]
Just place [color=00ffee][[/color][b][size=2][color=#66ff22]GearSwap.asi[/color][/size][/b][color=00ffee]][/color] & [color=00ffee][[/color][b][size=2][color=#66ff22]GearSwap.ini[/color][/size][/b][color=00ffee]][/color] into your Skyrim ROOT directory where your TESV.EXE is located, then run the game as normal.

[color=red][size=4]REQUIREMENTS[/size][/color]
Dragon Script is required for this mod to work

[color=red][size=4]FUTURE DEVELOPMENTS[/size][/color]
[list]
[*] Third Party Configuration tool, allowing you to add gear sets to the .INI
[*] Better Keybinding that is readable, such as [b]\"Key=SHIFT+F1\"[/b] allowing you to use key modifiers, instead of hexidecimal crap
[*] Hopefully able to detect the current characters armor-set in-game to save to a Armor Set depending on the modifier to save the outfit too
[/list]

[size=2][color=red]NOTE[/color][/size] - [b]Source code will be uploaded on full release[/b]
author: PROXiCiDE
